\begin{matlabcode}
% Task 1. Homogeneous coordinates. (Pen & paper exercise) (1 point)

% Converting points:
% from cartesian -> homogeneous
% x1 = (2, -1) -> (2, -1, 1)
% x2 = (1, -2) -> (1, -2, 1)
% x3 = (1, 1) -> (1, 1, 1)
% x4 = (-1, 0) -> (-1, 0, 1)

x1 = [2; -1;  1]
\end{matlabcode}
\begin{matlaboutput}
x1 = 3x1    
     2
    -1
     1

\end{matlaboutput}
\begin{matlabcode}
x2 = [1; -2; 1]
\end{matlabcode}
\begin{matlaboutput}
x2 = 3x1    
     1
    -2
     1

\end{matlaboutput}
\begin{matlabcode}
x3 = [1; 1;  1]
\end{matlabcode}
\begin{matlaboutput}
x3 = 3x1    
     1
     1
     1

\end{matlaboutput}
\begin{matlabcode}
x4 = [-1; 0; 1]
\end{matlabcode}
\begin{matlaboutput}
x4 = 3x1    
    -1
     0
     1

\end{matlaboutput}
\begin{matlabcode}

% Line(ij) = point(i) x point(j) (Cross product)

l1 = cross(x1, x2)
\end{matlabcode}
\begin{matlaboutput}
l1 = 3x1    
     1
    -1
    -3

\end{matlaboutput}
\begin{matlabcode}
l2 = cross(x3, x4)
\end{matlabcode}
\begin{matlaboutput}
l2 = 3x1    
     1
    -2
     1

\end{matlaboutput}
\begin{matlabcode}

% point(kl) = Line(k) x Line(l) (Cross product)
x = cross(l1,l2)
\end{matlabcode}
\begin{matlaboutput}
x = 3x1    
    -7
    -4
    -1

\end{matlaboutput}
\begin{matlabcode}

% Conversion back to Cartesian
% p = [u, v, w] -> (u/w, v/w)
% Therefore:

intersection_point = [x(1)/x(3), x(2)/x(3)]
\end{matlabcode}
\begin{matlaboutput}
intersection_point = 1x2    
     7     4

\end{matlaboutput}
\begin{matlabcode}

\end{matlabcode}
